sen.j: 永世禄（えいせいろく）とは、明治初期において王政復古 (日本)及び戊辰戦争に功績のあった者に恩賞として与えられた賞典禄の内、最も上位に属するもの。
sen.e: Eiseiroku (Literally meaning "forever-lasting Roku") is the highest Roku-type reward given to the warrior or political caste for their contribution to The Boshin War or The Restoration of Imperial rule in earlier Meiji era.

Eiseiroku (a type of premium) was the highest ranked Shotenroku (premium) in early Meiji era, which was awarded to ones with merits for their contribution to the Boshin War and the Restoration of Imperial Rule.
sen.cmt: 「The」を「the」と修正します。Roku-type reward としてもRokuの意味が分からないため、用語集通り、Shotenroku (premium)を使用します。(Literally meaning "forever-lasting Roku") の補足も、意味が分からないため、また永世禄とは、と文章内で説明されているので、必要ないので単に、(a type of premium)と変更します。過去なので過去形に直します。
sen.e: Eiseiroku (a type of premium) was the highest ranked Shotenroku (premium) in early Meiji era, which was awarded to ones with merits for their contribution to the Boshin War and the Restoration of Imperial Rule.

sen.j: 家禄と同様に無期限に給付され、子孫への世襲が許された（もっとも後述のように、実際には7年間で廃されている）。
sen.e: Similar to heredity stipend, the rewards are also passed on to their descendants. (As mentioned later, this reward system is actually abolished within the first seven years)
Similar to heredity stipend, the rewards were also passed on to their descendants (as mentioned later, this reward system was in fact abolished after seven years).
sen.cmt: 過去なので過去形に直します。ピリオドが括弧前にあっるので、文末に移動しました。カッコ内のAsをasと修正しました。Actually >> in fact と変更しました。within the first >> afterと変更しました。
sen.e: Similar to heredity stipend, the rewards were also passed on to their descendants (as mentioned later, this reward system was in fact abolished after seven years).

sen.j: 王政復古から戊辰戦争にかけて活躍した藩主・公卿・藩士などに給付された。
sen.e: These are mostly awarded to lords of domain, nobles, or warriors who demonstrated significant achievements over The Boshin War, or The Restoration of Imperial Rule. Eiseiroku is considered superior for its perpetuity, unlike other rewards which only last for one generation, one period of time, or simply a one-time payment.
The rewards were awarded to lords of domains, nobles, or warriors who demonstrated significant achievements over the Boshin War, or the Restoration of Imperial Rule.

sen.j: 本人1代のみの終身禄や期限が定められていた年限禄、俸禄ではなく一時金のみ支給されたものに比べて、永続性を持つ面においてより上位の待遇と言えた。
sen.e: Eiseiroku was considered superior for its perpetuity, unlike other rewards such as Shushinroku, which only lasted for a generation, Nengenroku, which had a fixed period of grant, and a one-off payment, which was not a horoku (salary).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処過去なので過去形に直します。「終身禄」「年限禄」「俸禄」が訳漏れです。文後半を書き直しました。
sen.e: Eiseiroku was considered superior for its perpetuity, unlike other rewards such as Shushinroku, which only lasted for a generation, Nengenroku, which had a fixed period of grant, and a one-off payment, which was not a horoku (salary).

sen.j: これによって、維新の功労者に対して一定の生活保障と明治政府への引き続きの協力を要請するという意味も含まれていた。
sen.e: These rewards promised definite livelihood protection to those contributors, but at the same time, also played a major role gaining their understanding and corporation for establishing the new Meiji government.
The purpose of these rewards were to guarantee living of those who had distinguished service in the Restoration, as well as to demand continuous assistance to Meiji government.

sen.j: だが、以上3つの総計が約80万石と大藩1つ分の禄高に相当し、財政基盤の弱い明治政府にとっては大きな財政負担となった。
sen.e: On the other hand, the government fell under budget deficit due to enormous expenditure of 800,000 Goku, which is equivalent to the area of lands of large-scale domain

However, total of above three rewards added up to 800,000 koku (144312.00 cubic meters), which was equal to total rokudaka (stipend) of taihan (large scale domain), and it became huge financial burden to Meiji government, which had a weak financial basis.

sen.e: However, total of above three rewards added up to 800,000 koku (144312.00 cubic meters), which was equal to total rokudaka (stipend) of taihan (large scale domain), and it became huge financial burden to Meiji government, which had a weak financial basis.

sen.j: このため、明治9年（1876年）の秩禄処分の際に、他の秩禄とともに金禄公債への整理・引換が行われ、永世禄はわずか7年間で廃止されたのである。
sen.e: For this reason, in 1876, Eiseiroku and other Roku-type rewards were abolished within seven years by converting and exchanging them into Kinroku Kōsai.

Therefore, Eiseiroku and other Chitsuroku (hereditary stipend) were consolidated and converted to Kinroku-kosai (Kinroku government securities) when Chitsuroku-shobun (Abolition Measure of Hereditary Stipend) was practiced and Eiseiroku was abolished in the brief span of 7 years.
